text: What A Selfless Act  That Goes Unnoticed Many of us here suffer in silence  and have yet  to do the ONE thing  That never leaves our mind  to end our own pain  Just so other s we leave behind won t be in pain   Many people are quick to call those who commit suicide selfish and inconsiderate   But never considered how long that person tried to hold on  Simply for the people around them   And for those who want to end it all  Yet  are still here whether it be for your pet  your partner  your parents  your friends  or your peer   Whatever the case may be  I just want to say I am proud of you  For pushing through shitty times  Even if it meant sleeping in bed all day  not doing a thing   Not everyone understands the amount of strength that takes

text: i literally flipped a coin to decide sorry if this doesn t belong here i m not the kind of person who can make decisions on my own  i ve spent the last few weeks just  going back and forth on whether or not i should just kill myself  i just got out of the shower  and as i was showering  i was drafting a suicide note in my mind  when i got back to my room i told myself no more going back and forth  you decide this now when i can t make a decision  i use my phone to flip a coin  even if it s something like what to have for dinner  i told myself  if i get heads  its a sign that i should go through with it  and start writing the suicide note for my roommate to find and give to my mom  if its tails  its a sign that i m not meant to die yet  and that i should keep fighting  i promised myself that i d follow through with whatever fate decided to give me i got tails   guess i ll be here a little while longer  if fate tells me to stay  i ll listen
summary: In order to decide whether or not to kill herself, she flipped a coin. If she got heads, she would write a suicide note for her roommate to find and give to her mom. If it got tails, she decided to keep fighting.
cleaned: order decide not kill flip coin get head write suicide note roommate find mon get tail decide fight

text: The  truth  that you were taught in church was nothing more than your pastor s personal perspectives and subjective interpretation of the Bible  Realizing this was a major turning point for me when it came to breaking down and deconstructing faith  If you think about all the Christian resources that offer to help you  from sermons  to devotionals  to workshops etc  they are all just the opinions of other people with a  divine inspiration  label slapped on it  One pastor says something is acceptable while another condemns it  Two pastors who both claim to each know  the truth  will point to one another and call the other a false teacher  It s evident in the plethora of denominations that make up Christianity  There are as many versions of Christianity as there are Christians  it seems  It really shows that this religion was made by people and it concentrates power in the hands of the leaders and spokespeople  It just becomes a cult of personality
summary: The truth that you were taught in church was nothing more than your pastor's personal perspectives and subjective interpretation of the Bible. Christian resources are all just the opinions of other people with a divine inspiration label slapped on it. There are as many versions of Christianity as there are Christians.
cleaned: truth teach church pastor personal perspective subjective interpretation bible christian resource opinion people divine inspiration label slap version christianity christians
